paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the Val50Met variant in the TTR gene, its prevalence, and associated penetrance data in individuals with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv).

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Of the 49 patients evaluated, 28 were symptomatic (57.1%) and 21 were asymptomatic (42.9%).

functional_data.summary: The Val50Met mutation is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to renal tubular dysfunction.

variants.segregation_data: The Val50Met mutation is known to segregate with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the high prevalence of the Val50Met variant in the population studied.
key_quotes: 94% had the genetic variant Val50Met and 57% were symptomatic.
Nephropathy is more common in women, in patients with late-onset neuropathy, in cases with low family penetrance.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the Val50Met variant in the TTR gene.
